item.title: Ethernet Bandwidth Gets Incrementally Finer
item.description:
Metro Ethernet service has been very beneficial for businesses of all sizes. It not only keeps LAN-WAN-LAN connections using the Ethernet protocol, but lease prices are also typically much lower per Mbps than older services like T-Carrier and SONET. But wouldn’t it be great to have the ideal line speed without settling for a service that’s too small or paying too much for unnecessary bandwidth? Fortunately, XO Communications, a leading Metro Ethernet WAN service provider, now offers a wide range of bandwidth options for businesses with on-net fiber optic service...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/ethernet-bandwidth-gets-incrementally-finer/

item.title: Increasing T1 Speed
item.description:
For decades, T1 lines have been the standard for business network connections, offering ample bandwidth initially. However, like computer advancements, what was sufficient before is now inadequate. While upgrading to fiber is an option, it’s not the only solution. Many companies opt for the traditional upgrade path from T1 (1.5 Mbps) to T3 (45 Mbps) speeds. This offers a significant speed increase at a premium, though T3 costs have decreased...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/increasing-t1-speed/
